intro: Coccothrinax boxii, commonly known as the Cuban palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the island of Cuba and is characterized by its slender, erect trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue, fleshy fruits. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
